Accounts Officer Job at University Press Plc




        
    

        
        University Press Plc (UPPLC) was founded in 1949 under the name of Oxford University Press Nigeria, and has grown to become one of the oldest, most experienced and the Nation’s Foremost Publishers of materials for educational and for general reading. At incorporation as a public liability company in 1978, the Company’s name was changed to University Press Limited with an authorised share capital of 8,000,000 Ordinary shares of 50k each. Quoted on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on 14th August 1978, UPPLC has, on two occasions, won the prestigious Stock Exchange Merit Award in the service sector of quoted companies. It has also won, for two consecutive years, 1984 and 1985, the Concord Prize for Excellence in Academic Publishing.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Receipts and daily banking of sales proceeds.
	Monitoring and reconciliation of customers balances.
	Prepare debtor accounts and ensure prompt collection of payment on credit sales.
	Preparation and reconciliation of depot float account.
	Reconcile all depot transaction accounts.
	Write daily, weekly and monthly sales reports to the Head office.
	Filing and payments of staff monthly PAYE, Nominal roll and Annual Returns with the Revenue Board.
	Ensure compliance with established controls and policies at the Depot and report contravention(s) immediately.
	Write and issue out cheques.
	Perform other related duties as may be assigned.


Qualifications & Required Skills


	A relevant first degree (BSc/HND) in Accounting with a minimum of second-class lower division/lower credit.
	At least three (3) years of post-qualification experience in a similar position.
	Membership of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria will be an added advantage.
	Not more than 35 years of age.
	Must have the ability to pay attention to details.
	Proficiency in statistical analysis.
	Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
	Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Must be proactive and versatile.
	Applicant must be a resident in Benin City or willing to relocate.


Note: The recruitment process will be carried out at our Benin Depot.

title: Job Vacancies at NEVADA Restaurant and Lounge
content:
NEVADA Restaurant and Lounge offers exquisite dining, chic lounge, live music & events and signature Cocktails.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Mixologist

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and serve a wide range of cocktails, mocktails, and other beverages.
	Ensure the bar area is well-stocked, organized, and clean.
	Deliver exceptional customer service and maintain a lively bar atmosphere.
	Suggest innovative drink recipes and seasonal menu ideas.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Mixologist or Bartender.
	Excellent knowledge of cocktails, wines, and bar operations.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be creative, punctual, and customer-focused.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and application letter to: hr1nevada@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email or deliver in person to the restaurant.

 

 

2.) Grill Chef

Job Location: Port Harcourt, GRA, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and passionate Grill Chef to join our culinary team.
	The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with grilling techniques, preparing high-quality dishes, and maintaining food safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and grill meats, poultry, seafood, and vegetables to perfection.
	Develop and present creative grill menu options.
	Ensure food quality, taste, and presentation meet company standards.
	Maintain a clean, safe, and organized workstation at all times.
	Monitor stock levels and communicate supply needs.
	Adhere to all food hygiene and safety regulations.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Grill Chef, Cook, or in a similar role.
	Knowledge of different grilling methods and seasonings.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Team player with excellent communication skills.
	Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	Opportunities for growth and skill development.
	A dynamic and supportive work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr1nevada@gmail.com using “Application – Grill Chef” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Chef

Job Location: Port Harcourt, GRA, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking to employ a professional Chef to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, preparing, and delivering high-quality meals while maintaining the highest standards of hygiene, creativity, and consistency.


Responsibilities


	Plan and prepare a wide variety of meals and menus.
	Ensure proper presentation and portioning of all dishes.
	Maintain kitchen hygiene and compliance with food safety standards.
	Monitor inventory, manage kitchen supplies, and minimize wastage.
	Supervise and train kitchen staff when required.
	Incorporate creativity and innovation into recipes and food presentation.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Chef in a reputable organization.
	Strong knowledge of various cuisines and modern cooking techniques.
	Ability to manage time, pressure, and multitasking effectively.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.
	A relevant culinary certification is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: hr1nevada@gmail.com using “Application for Chef Position” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
